eventName: So Long, Adele: Home Away From Home
storyInfo: With the bidding over, Bison and Swire celebrate their successful farce, only to immediately receive news that their plans have been disrupted. Ceylon learns about Siesta's difficulties and proactively looks for the men behind the illegal obsidian miners and express willingness to provide assistance. In her uncertainty, Eyjafjalla finds a lone Little Black Sheep still in Siesta.

attributes.content: Here are the results of the latest public opinion survey.
attributes.name: City Hall Staffer

attributes.content: The Schwire Group's Aquatic Paradise proposal is supported by 33% of those polled, while the MountainDash Logistics center proposal is supported by 21% of those polled.
attributes.name: City Hall Staffer

attributes.content: The other competitors are all hovering at around 10%.
attributes.name: City Hall Staffer

attributes.content: Although the result of the public opinion survey is only one of the factors that the city government considers when making its decision, based on the current results, the Schwire Group's proposal has the advantage.
attributes.name: City Hall Staffer

attributes.content: Say no more. I'm sure Mr. Bison here can figure out the situation by himself.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Surely Miss Swire didn't invite me and the city government here just to gloat over the results?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Of course not. Bison, sir, I'd like to make a deal.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: The Schwire Group will drop out of the bidding, but in return, I want to buy into MountainDash Logistics's company here.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Hasn't that been your goal all along?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Not entirely, but I thought about it little afterwards, and your being here isn't all bad news to me.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: A smart businessperson always looks for possibilities where both parties gain something and makes decisions that yields the maximum profits given the situation.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Going by what you said... If you were really so confident, you wouldn't have come negotiate with me.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Well, would you not agree that trading a percentage of your shares in exchange for your biggest rival's exit is a good deal?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: How much are you looking at?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Swire lightly knocks on the table three times.
I want this much.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I will report your arrangement to the mayor and continue to inform you of any further arrangements.
attributes.name: City Hall Staffer

attributes.content: I wish you two a pleasant time in Siesta.
attributes.name: City Hall Staffer

attributes.content: Is that all for the show?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: For the time being, I guess.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Phew—
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Haha... Hahaha...
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: What's so funny?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Sorry, sorry... I just didn't expect... that you'd resort to these means, too, Commissioner Swire...
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: If I were to openly invest in MountainDash's business, forget about registering our own company. They'd write MountainDash up for thousands of reasons and shut it down on our first day in Siesta.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: My family's wary of me. Good thing they aren't that wary of me yet. As long as they still see me as a young, hot-headed superintendent, I can still cover my actions with that as a ruse.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Phew—I'm really fortunate that I'm not actually your business rival.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: This is just the first step, though. The Federation of Enterprises will put it all together sooner or later. We'll face all sorts of difficulties going forward. Are you ready?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Having come this far, it's probably too late for me to have any regrets.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Well, partners, then?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Yeah, I look forward to—
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Your terminal?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: No, isn't it yours?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Swire and Bison each take out their terminals. They take a brief look at each other, before hitting their respective answer keys.
Hello, is this Bison, the legal representative of Mountaincomm Trade?
attributes.name: Polite Voice

attributes.content: Hello, is this Miss Swire?
attributes.name: Hushed Voice

attributes.content: The city hall has received a report that your company has illegally employed undocumented Infected. At this point, we need your company to immediately cease all operations.
attributes.name: Polite Voice

attributes.content: Please prepare the following documents for the city government's investigation. First, we need the list of all Infected employees working for your company...
attributes.name: Polite Voice

attributes.content: Miss Swire, that was an interesting show, and it did buy you some time for your prank. Unfortunately, the group is very unhappy with your decision.
attributes.name: Hushed Voice

attributes.content: You should know that there are limits to what you should and shouldn't do. This investment game is over.
attributes.name: Hushed Voice

attributes.content: Thank you for your cooperation. Goodbye.
attributes.name: Polite Voice

attributes.content: This stops here. I hope you'll think about the consequences of your actions.
attributes.name: Hushed Voice

attributes.content: This is some uncalled-for slander.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Well, it's pretty obvious who snitched on us. They're trying to buy time right before we sign our contract just so they can catch up.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: But why use the Infected as an excuse... Since when has Siesta had any policies against the Infected in any way?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: We don't have time to deal with these setbacks.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: If only we could convince Mayor Herman—
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: You're right. Herman is our chance at a breakthrough, but what reason does he have to stand on our side...?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Besides, if my hunch's correct, he's probably being pressured in some other way right now.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Mayor Herman, you're a hard man to reach.
attributes.name: Columbian Representative

attributes.content: I thought my answer before was more than clear. There is nothing for you and I to discuss in person.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: Naturally, Columbia respects all the rights that Siesta enjoys as an independent city state. I am here today for a different matter—Siesta's Infected question.
attributes.name: Columbian Representative

attributes.content: Columbian federal law states that Infected citizens must be enrolled in a suitable healthcare plan in order to reside in our nomadic cities. Otherwise, they must join the Pioneer Teams.
attributes.name: Columbian Representative

attributes.content: Siesta was not a nomadic city, and so it was not bound by this regulation. However, given the current circumstances, we need to reevaluate the rule of law here.
attributes.name: Columbian Representative

attributes.content: So this word game is your idea of pressuring me?
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: I hope you grasp the situation, Mayor Herman.
attributes.name: Columbian Representative

attributes.content: This is not a negotiation.
attributes.name: Columbian Representative

attributes.content: Since when do we need to be so sneaky about buying obsidian?
attributes.name: Tired Worker

attributes.content: What choice do we have? They've been pretty strict with inspections lately. But this is a great opportunity for people like you, in-the-know, to seize the day!
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: The logistics center will be done soon, and there are lots of merchants waiting to buy obsidian.
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Ugh, when has Siestan obsidian ever been all that rare? You probably have plenty hidden in your shop yourself. Why come to me?
attributes.name: Weary Worker

attributes.content: What they want is freshly-mined obsidian. What's it...? Volcano-heated obsidian contains the land's energy and has amazing health benefits!
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Alright, I'll stop messing with you. Do you have any other new obsidian pieces, aside from this basket? Whatever you've got, I have buyers lined up. If the quality's good enough, they're willing to pay this much.
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Enis gestures a number with his hands.
That much? Yeah, I do. I dug up a bunch just a couple days ago.
attributes.name: Spirited Worker

attributes.content: Oh? So recently?
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Yep. I kept some real pretty ones—Look, these are some mighty fine obsidians, don't you think?
attributes.name: Spirited Worker

attributes.content: They're lovely indeed.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Now, would you please tell me more about your illegal obsidian mining operation?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Enis! You set me up, didn't you?! When did you fall so low?
attributes.name: Nervous Worker

attributes.content: Uh, this isn't exactly a set up now, is it? A cop with a really loud mouth taught me this... Sorry, Uncle Jackie. This is for your own good. You shouldn't put your health on the line.
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: We just have a couple questions we want to ask you. Work with us, will you?
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: That's everything...
attributes.name: Discouraged Worker

attributes.content: Are you gonna lock us up?
attributes.name: Dispirited Worker

attributes.content: Who were you planning to sell the obsidian to?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Is it Pelipper?
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: No... Pelipper stopped buying from us a long time ago, and he's a man of his word. He hasn't bought a single pebble. No matter how high quality the obsidian, he doesn't so much as take a single glance.
attributes.name: Discouraged Worker

attributes.content: Hmph... You got all this out of us, but what good is it going to do?
attributes.name: Dispirited Worker

attributes.content: That bastard Herman's always doing whatever he wants without a thought to the consequences. First, he made us all stop mining obsidian. Then, he said the volcano was going to erupt. It's been almost two years since we moved here, and it hasn't so much as let out a puff of smoke!
attributes.name: Dispirited Worker

attributes.content: Maybe he should've taken a look at where our money was coming from just a couple years ago...
attributes.name: Discouraged Worker

attributes.content: But doesn't Siesta have really lax Infected policies...?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: That doesn't mean they've got jobs for us! If all the out-of-work miners became drivers, they could probably tow the city a couple kilometers.
attributes.name: Discouraged Worker

attributes.content: Besides, I'm already infected. What else can I do? Once MountainDash Logistics moves into the city, we'll have even more people without work. Now the Mayor's talking about tearing the shopping district down. Why tear it down, even? Just to chase us out of here?
attributes.name: Dispirited Worker

attributes.content: Maybe... Maybe the Mayor will come up with a policy to help you guys...
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Forget it. Haven't you heard? They're going to chase us Infected out. The Columbians are here.
attributes.name: Dispirited Worker

attributes.content: Where did you hear that?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: We all know how the Columbians treat the Infected. If something does end up happening, we might as well just head out into the wastes ourselves and start pioneering.
attributes.name: Dispirited Worker

attributes.content: That shell-brain Herman... That darned shell-brain!
attributes.name: Discouraged Worker

attributes.content: Ugh... *cough*! *cough*!
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: What's wrong? Are you sick?
attributes.name: Discouraged Worker

attributes.content: No, no. Uh, I...
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Uh, Dr. Ceylon, they're also...
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: The Mayor must be having a tough time, too. Don't get mad over this...
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: No, I'm not mad.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I thought this was just going to be warning a few men to stop illegal mining, but if the Columbians are here, that changes everything...
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: This is Siesta's own problem.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Sir, how many are still mining obsidian?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: I'll come out and say it. I'm not going to turn you in to the police.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: Enis said it just now. I'm a doctor. I know it's not realistic to just stop your obsidian work. What I want to do is help you solve this problem... Please trust me.
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: So, won't you tell me?
attributes.name: Ceylon

attributes.content: What do you mean, you're going to help us?
attributes.name: Dispirited Worker

attributes.content: Uh, who are you...? And why?
attributes.name: Dispirited Worker

attributes.content: Hold on... You look familiar...
attributes.name: Discouraged Worker

attributes.content: Hah, you finally figured out, huh? You watched the Obsidian Festival broadcasts, right? Remember the lady at the closing ceremonies with Mayor Herman?
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Who? No, no, no. I'm saying you look a lot like a woman I once met...
attributes.name: Discouraged Worker

attributes.content: It was a long time ago, and we worked at the obsidian mines together.
attributes.name: Discouraged Worker

attributes.content: There was a scholar from Victoria. She was pregnant, but she went to the mines every day, for environmental surveys or whatever.
attributes.name: Discouraged Worker

attributes.content: She didn't know that much about mining, but she was real kind to us...
attributes.name: Discouraged Worker

attributes.content: Oh, now I remember. Her name was... Bora... No, Barbara.
attributes.name: Discouraged Worker

attributes.content: The creature, with the miner's lamp on its back, trots along in short spurts as it gazes toward Old Siesta's beach.
There, Byrd is sitting on the sand, plucking away at her strings spontaneously.
Do you come here often?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Hmm, you can still see Old Siesta here...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Well, music is pleasing to the ear, and the sound of the waves, carried on the wind, is good accompaniment for the guitar.
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: I didn't expect you to ask me that, though... So you're actually willing to talk.
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: Huh? Isn't this what one would normally do...?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Yeah... I guess it is. maybe I'm just a bit too narrow-minded.
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: If everything can talk to everything else, then music might be the best language there is. Even if you don't speak the same tongue, music can help you convey your truest thoughts—Not bad. This feels like a new inspiration.
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: Byrd starts strumming a slow, relaxed song. The waves rise and fall along to her rhythm.
You two are the first to hear this piece.
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: 'You two?' Oh... Are you including this fowlbeast here? Maybe the grass?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Hm? No.
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: Don't we have another listener here?
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: Byrd points at the steps next to them which, logically, should be empty.
Weren't you talking to it the whole time?
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: Miss Byrd... You can see it?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: The creature with a miner's lamp on its back stands on the beach and gazes blankly at the silhouette of Old Siesta in the distance. It hesitantly tries to step into the seawater, but after a few plods, it walks back onto land.
Its takes its hoofsteps rhythmically, as though it is trying to match the music's beat, though it also looks like it isn't and is just trying to maintain its own rhythm.
Ba-dump, ba-dump, ba-dump...
Yeah, I've been able to see it since the day I came to Siesta.
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: Just the one?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Are there others?
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: Too bad... This is the only one I can see.
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: Byrd looks at the lamp on the creature's back and the hard hat and goggles on its head.
I wrote the miners of Old Siesta a song. Maybe it just happens to like things that have to do with ores?
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: I'll play the song again, just for it.
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: Byrd starts strumming again, while Adele brushes her dress's hem and sits down next to Byrd.
Come to think of it, even though there hasn't been a single song of mine that could represent my whole life, perhaps there's one or two that could give comfort to somebody out there...
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: ...even if my audience is just a lone... Little Black Sheep?
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: But that's not so bad!
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: It stayed behind to listen to you play your guitar.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: You said you could see more of them. Where are they?
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: They... They disappeared all of a sudden. I don't know where they went.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Do they eat road signs like this one?
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: I don't think so...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Hm, I have an idea.
attributes.name: Byrd

attributes.content: Do you think this one eats road signs because... it's a stray sheep?
attributes.name: Byrd
